result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dejinara D Madison

records.addlTxt: Order Appointing Counsel, signed and filed.
Order Appointing Counsel, forwarded to Judge for signature.

Defendant Dejinara D Madison appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant stated she does not qualify for State Public Defender representation and requests a court appointed attorney.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  
Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Andrew Golden to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. 
The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the close of the case and then the 1st of each month there after.  
Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. 
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. 
Court authorized defendant to appear by Zoom.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-16-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Dejinara D Madison in court. Student Intern Madeline Witte under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/14/22 @ 2:30p
